intro: Filipendula ulmaria var. pleniflora, commonly known as Queen of the Meadow, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and abundant, fluffy white to pinkish flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that develop into pink, velvety bracts, which are often mistaken for petals. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, marshes, and along stream banks. The plant is also known for its fragrant leaves and is sometimes used in herbal remedies.
